title: Limits at infinity of quotients with square roots
description: Find limits at infinity of rational functions with a radical expression in the numerator or denominator.

title: Limits at infinity of quotients with trig
description: Sal finds the limit of cosx/(x¬≤-1) at infinity, by putting it between two limits of rational functions, 1/(x¬≤-1) and -1/(x¬≤-1).

Topic B: The standard algorithm for multi-digit whole number multiplication
description:
Topic B includes lessons 3-9.  "Write and interpret numerical expressions, and compare expressions using a visual model.  Convert numerical expressions into unit form as a mental strategy for multi-digit multiplication.  Connect visual models and the distributive property to partial products of the standard algorithm without renaming.  Connect area models and the distributive property to partial products of the standard algorithm with renaming.  Fluently multiply multi-digit whole numbers using the standard algorithm and using estimation to check for reasonableness of the product.  Fluently multiply multi-digit whole numbers using the standard algorithm to solve multi-step word problems." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

(Currently, we do not have content for Lessons 3, 4, and 9.)

title: Topic A: Addition and subtraction of integers and rational numbers
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-9 and covers opposite quantities combine to make zero, using the number line to model the addition of integers, understanding addition of integers, efficiently adding integers and other rational numbers, understanding subtraction of integers and other rational numbers, the distance between two rational numbers, addition and subtraction of rational numbers, and applying the properties of operations to add and subtract rational numbers.

title: Topic C: Decimal multi-digit multiplication
description:
Topic C includes lessons 10-12.  "Multiply decimal fractions with tenths by multi-digit whole numbers using place value understanding to record partial products.  Multiply decimal fractions by multi-digit whole numbers through conversion to a whole number problem and reasoning about the placement of the decimal.   Reason about the product of a whole number and a decimal with hundredths using place value understanding and estimation." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

Content coming soon!

title: Topic B: Lessons 9-12: Creating probability distributions
Topic C: Lessons 13-19: Applications of expected value and probability
Topic D: Measurement word problems with whole number and decimal multiplication
description: Topic D includes lessons 13-15.  "Use whole number multiplication to express equivalent measurements.  Use fraction and decimal multiplication to express equivalent measurements.  Solve two-step word problems involving measurement conversions." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic A: Solving word problems
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-3.  "Solve word problems in varied contexts using a letter to represent the unknown.  Share and critique peer solution strategies to varied word problems."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic B: Attributes of two-dimensional figures
description:
Topic B includes lessons 4-9.  "Compare and classify quadrilaterals.  Compare and classify other polygons.  Draw polygons with specified attributes to solve problems.  Reason about composing and decomposing polygons using tetrominoes.  Create a tangram puzzle and observe relationships among the shapes.  Reason about composing and decomposing polygons using tangrams."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

(Currently, we do not have content for Lessons 7, 8, and 9.)

title: Topic C: Problem solving with perimeter
description:
Topic C includes lessons 10-17.  "Decompose quadrilaterals to understand perimeter as the boundary of a shape.  Measure side lengths in whole number units to determine the perimeter of polygons.  Explore perimeter as an attribute of plane figures and solve problems.  Determine the perimeter of regular polygons and rectangles when whole number measurements are unknown.  Solve word problems to determine perimeter with given side lengths.  Use string to measure the perimeter of various circles to the nearest quarter inch.  Use all four operations to solve problems involving perimeter and unknown measurements."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 16.)

title: Topic B: Multiplication and division of integers and rational numbers
description: Topic B includes lessons 10-16 and covers understanding multiplication of integers, develop rules for multiplying signed numbers, division of integers, converting between fractions and decimals using equivalent fractions, converting rational numbers to decimals using long division, multiplication and division of rational numbers, and applying the properties of operations to multiply and divide rational numbers.

title: Topic E: Mental strategies for multi-digit whole number division
description:
Topic E includes lessons 16-18.  "Use "divide by 10" patterns for multi-digit whole number division.  Use basic facts to approximate quotients with two-digit divisors." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org  

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 17.)

title: Topic F: Partial quotients and multi-digit whole number division
description: Topic F includes lessons 19-23.  "Divide two- and three-digit dividends by two-digit divisors with single-digit quotients and make connections to a written method.  Divide three- and four-digit dividends by two-digit divisors resulting in two- and three-digit quotients, reasoning about the decomposition of successive remainders in each place value." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic D: Recording perimeter and area data on line plots
description:
Topic D includes lessons 18-22.  "Construct rectangles from a given number of unit squares and determine the perimeters.  Use a line plot to record the number of rectangles constructed from a given number of unit squares.  Construct rectangles with a given perimeter using unit squares and determine their areas.  Use a line plot to record the number of rectangles constructed in Lessons 20 and 21."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

Content coming soon!

title: Topic B: Lesson 14: Graphing factored polynomials
Topic G: Partial quotients and multi-digit decimal division
description: Topic G includes lessons 24-27.  "Divide decimal dividends by multiples of 10, reasoning about the placement of the decimal point and making connections to a written method.  Use basic facts to approximate decimal quotients with two-digit divisors, reasoning about the placement of the decimal point.  Divide decimal dividends by two-digit divisors, estimating quotients, reasoning about the placement of the decimal point, and making connections to a written method." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic E: Problem solving with perimeter and area
description:
Topic E includes lessons 23-30.  "Solve a variety of word problems with perimeter.  Use rectangles to draw a robot with specified perimeter measurements, and reason about the different areas that may be produced.  Solve a variety of word problems involving area and perimeter using all four operations.  Share and critique peer strategies for problem solving."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 24 and 30.)

title: Topic B: Lesson 15: Structure in graphs of polynomial functions
Topic A: Lessons 1-3: Arithmetic sequence intro
Topic B: Lessons 16-21: Remainder theorem and modeling
Topic A: Lessons 1-3: Geometric sequence intro
Topic C: Lessons 22-23: Simplifying rational expressions
Topic A: Lessons 1-3: Arithmetic sequence formulas
Topic E: Multiplication and division using units of 4
description: Topic E includes lessons 14-17.  "Skip-count objects in models to build fluency with multiplication facts using units of 4.  Relate arrays to tape diagrams to model the commutative property of multiplication.  Use the distributive property as a strategy to find related multiplication facts.  Model the relationship between multiplication and division." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic A: Square and cube roots
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-5 and covers the Pythagorean theorem, square roots, existence and uniqueness of square roots and cube roots, simplifying square roots (Optional), and solving equations with radicals.

title: Topic C: Lesson 25: Adding and subtracting rational expressions
Topic F: Distributive property and problem solving using units of 2‚Äì5 and 10
description: Topic F includes lessons 18-21.  "Apply the distributive property to decompose units.  Solve two-step word problems involving multiplication and division and assess the reasonableness of answers.  Solve two-step word problems involving all four operations and assess the reasonableness of answers." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic A: Measurement conversion tables
description:
Topic A includes lessons 1-5.  "Create conversion tables for length, weight, and capacity units using measurement tools, and use the tables to solve problems.  Create conversion tables for units of time, and use the tables to solve problems.  Solve multiplicative comparison word problems using measurement conversion tables."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 4.)

title: Topic B: Decimal expansions of numbers
description:
Topic B includes lessons 6-14 and covers finite and infinite decimals, infinite decimals, the long division algorithm, decimal expansions of fractions, converting repeating decimals to fractions, the decimal expansion of some irrational numbers, comparing irrational numbers, and decimal expansion of pi.

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 8 and 14.)

title: Working with the intermediate value theorem
Optional videos
description: Some things are not explicitly required by the AP Calculus BC course, but many teachers cover them and we also find them useful. We've gathered those optional videos here for your convenience.

Topic D: Further applications
description:

Solve multi-step word problems; assess reasonableness of solutions using benchmark numbers.  Explore part to whole relationships." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: Topic D: Lesson 37: Complex number operations

description: Topic C includes lessons 12-15 and covers estimating digits in a quotient, dividing multi-digit numbers using the algorithm, the division algorithm‚Äîconverting decimal division into whole number division using fractions, and the division algorithm‚Äîconverting decimal division into whole number division using mental math.

title: Topic A: Use properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-6 and covers generating equivalent expressions, writing products as sums and sums as products, using the identity and inverse to write equivalent expressions, and collecting rational number like terms.

Topic D: Number theory‚Äîthinking logically about multiplicative arithmetic

title: Topic B: Solve problems using expressions, equations, and inequalities
description:
Topic B includes lessons 7-15 and covers understanding equations, using if-then moves in solving equations, angle problems and solving equations, properties of inequalities, inequalities, solving inequalities, and graphing solutions to inequalities.

title: Topic A: Place value of multi-digit whole numbers
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-4.  "Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison.  Recognize a digit represents 10 times the value of what it represents in the place to its right.  Name numbers within 1 million by building understanding of the place value chart and placement of commas for naming base thousand units.  Read and write multi-digit numbers using base ten numerals, number names, and expanded form."  Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

description: Topic A includes lessons 1-6 and covers exponential notation, multiplication and division of numbers in exponential form, numbers in exponential form raised to a power, numbers raised to the zeroth power, negative exponents and the laws of exponents, and proofs of laws of exponents.

description:

(Currently, we do not have content for Lesson 18.)

title: Topic A: Time measurement and problem solving
description: Topic A includes lessons 1-5.  "Explore time as a continuous measurement using a stopwatch.   Relate skip-counting by fives on the clock and telling time to a continuous measurement model, the number line.  Count by fives and ones on the number line as a strategy to tell time to the nearest minute on the clock.  Solve word problems involving time intervals within 1 hour by counting backward and forward using the number line and clock. title: Topic A: Lessons 8-10: Trigonometric graphs and radians

Estimate and measure liquid volume in liters and milliliters using the vertical number line.  Solve mixed word problems involving all four operations with grams, kilograms, liters, and milliliters given in the same units." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

Express metric capacity measurements in terms of a smaller unit; model and solve addition and subtraction word problems involving metric capacity." Eureka Math/EngageNY (c) 2015 GreatMinds.org

title: How computers compute
description: Even though we think of computers as super high-tech machines with tiny parts, they can also be huge, wooden, and mechanical. It's what they have in common that makes them computers - switches!

title: Topic A: Lessons 6-7: Solving basic one-variable quadratic equations

title: Inka
description: From their capital, Cuzco, in the central Peruvian Andes, the Inca created a huge empire reaching over 2,400 miles along the length of the Andes. The supreme head of state was the king, considered a living god ruling by divine right and the royal family controlled important areas of government such as the army.

title: The Fascinating Fibonaccis
description: Almost a thousand years ago, an Indian scholar called Hemachandra discovered a fascinating number sequence. A century later, the same sequence caught the attention of Italian mathematician Fibonacci, who wrote about it. The Fibonacci sequence, as it began to be called, was straightforward enough - what made it fascinating was that this particular set of numbers was repeated many, many times in nature - in flowers, seashells, eggs, seeds, stars... Find out more inside this book!

title: Bhabho the Buffalo

Bhabho the Buffalo had beautiful horns. One day, her horns got wet in the
rain. Dirt blew in her direction and stuck to her wet horns. The next day, a bird
flying by dropped a seed that fell on Bhabho‚Äôs horn. Soon the seed sprouted into
a tree. What will Bhabho do with a tree growing on her horns?

title: Animals Run Away
description: Four animals run away from their ungrateful owners to find a place to live on their own.

title: Who is The Next Ruler?
description: Who will be the king of animals after King Leopard dies?

title: Elephant and the Spirit
description: Who is stronger? Elephant or spirit?

title: Douangkeo Wants to Be a Magician
description: Douangkeo wants to be a magician! She practices magic tricks and performs for her dog. Can you guess what Douangkeo needs to wear to look like a magician?

title: Frog's Starry Wish
description: Frog loves to gaze at the stars. One night he decides he wants to touch them. He climbs a rock, a tall coconut tree, even a hillock! But the stars are always out of reach. Will Frog ever find a way to be near the stars?

title: Chicken and Millipede
description: An adorable tale on why chicken and millipedes are enemies.

title: Amazing Daisy
description: Daisy, the little chicken always wanted to fly, but all the other farm animals make fun of her practicing. Until one say something amazing happens.

title: Jealous Anansi
description: Where does Anansi's jealousy lead him?

title: Little and Big
description: A simple book on what is little and what is big.

title: Aku, the Sun Maker
description: A dejected girl finds an unlikely friend, bringing joy to the village.

title: Annoying Mosquito
description: Who is disturbing me just as I'm about to fall asleep?

title: Mission of the Fish
description: A school of fish has a mission: to get rid of garbage in their home. Together they work to convince humans to keep the water clean. Do you think humans will listen to the fish?

description: Kila siku ni mwanzo mpya kwa Feni,  msichana mdogo anayejaribu kufanya anavyoambiwa. Katika hadithi hii,  Feni anapata mshangao anapokuwa akitafuta kuni na babake. Feni na Nyoka Kijani Kibichi inahusu maisha ya kweli ya mtoto msichana anayekua katika sehemu za mashambani.

title: Fire on the mountain

author: African Storybook

author: Ibraahim Baabayo

title: Go bala dikatse
description: Pukwana ye e bolela ka go bala go tloga go lefeela go ya go senyane.
author: Dikeledi Queen Shai

title: Go bala diphoofolo
description: Diphoofolo ka moka di swerwe ke lenyora. Di a balwa ge di le tseleng di lebile go yo nwa meetse.
author: Dikeledi Queen Shai

title: Gumusinze (Oluyimba mu Luganda)
description: Omuwala eyalimba jjajawe nga amazze okuba emeere. Zula engeri jjajja we' yafuna omubi.
author: Uganda Christian University

title: Harold the Horse
description: Harold is a hardworking horse his character causes him satisfaction but other animals think otherwise.
author: Hannington Owere

title: The Conical Hat
description: This is a little poem about a conical hat. It is a hat woven from cane. It is used for many things. Would you like to know more about this delightful little hat?

title: Elders!
description: When the elders are greedy for the food at home, how will the children react?

title: Black Ant
description: Black Ant is a courageous ant who likes to go on adventures in the bush, meet other animals and learn new things. What do you think will happen on her next adventure?

title: The Bee and the Elephant
description: An elephant tries to help a little lost bee find his home. Is it the nest? The cave? Where does he live?

title: Piggy Wants to Fly
description: As Piggy gazes upon a butterfly happy in flight, Piggy dreams of flying. Can Piggy learn to fly like a butterfly?

title: Billy to the Rescue
description: Putting out fires makes Billy the fire engine dirty. Will he still do his work?

title: My First Pair of Shoes
description: Do you remember your first pair of shoes? Read this story of a young girl who is excited about her shoes.

title: The Lost Doll
description: Abi loves her doll very much, but one day it goes missing. What will she do?

title: Bravo Burli!
description: The wise people of the Kondh tribe live close to the forest. They know each zigzag path, each large sal and mohua tree, each pug mark of the mongoose and the tiger, and so much more! Young Burli is beginning to read the signs of nature, but is she ready to face the most dangerous ordeal of her life?

title: Greedy Kiundu
description: Kiundu is a greedy, selfish man. How will he make the best of the two parties going on in the village?

title: 'M'e Maneo's Pumpkin
description: 'M'e Maneo plants a pumpkin seed which grows into a huge pumpkin. In the Summer, the pumpkin has a big surprise for the people in the valley.

title: Ramuramu, the Goat
description: Ramuramu the goat escapes from the farm only to find out that the safest and friendliest place is home.

title: Magozwe Finds a Home
description: A boy from the streets finds a home.

Mwana wa njobvu uyu anali ndi mafunso ambiri pa zintu zambiri,  monga cakudya ca kumadzulo ca ng'wena. Mbalame chikwalala zinakwezeka mwana wa njobvu kuka pita ku mtsinje kukaona. title: Thambu's Kite
description: Thambu loves flying his kite. One day, the string breaks while Thambu is flying it. What will Thambu do?

title: Joongedai's Things
description: Joongedai does not keep his room clean. His belongings are scattered all over the place. All his things are angry with him for not keeping them in the right places. They feel unwanted and neglected. How will they convince Joongedai to keep his room more neat?

title: Mama wangu
description: Iyi adisi bana ajika yo kwa mutoto mwana ume dju ya kufrahisha mama wake. (Iyi adisi baliyadjika yo jiku ya kupumushika ya watoto mu Sophiatown Community Psychological Services mu Johannesburg,  July 2018.).

title: Leero ndi
description: Megha anabera ki leero? Muyimbi, muvumbuzi?

title: Byantaka and the Dead Pot
description: Byantaka, the heardsman desperately wanted a big pot, so he decided to trick his neighbour to get it.
